Erik Wilde (@dret): Using the Network Effect: API Strategy is more than Technology

(2) Summary

APIs are more than just technology. The more APIs are being used, the more it becomes obvious that a focus just on technology does not fully realize their potential for the business and the organization. In particular in larger organizations, it is necessary to API-enable the entire organization. This is particularly important in product management, which has to make sure that every product becomes a digital building block. The network effect means that the value of APIs is a function of what fraction of the organization is API-enabled, meaning that increasing that fraction is an important aspect of increasing the value of APIs. "Thinking the API way" should become the default for everybody working in an organization, and in this presentation we discuss some examples of how to make this happen.

(7) Network Investments Don't Grow Linearly



Scaling is Hard Erik Wilde (@dret): Using the Network Effect: API Strategy is more than Technology

(8) How do APIs Create Value?

Digital Transformation means adapting an organization's strategy and structure to capture opportunities enabled by digital technology. (Nathan Furr and Andrew Shipilov, Digital Doesn't Have to Be Disruptive, Harvard Business Review 97(4), July/August 2019, pp. 94-103) [https://hbr.org/2019/07/digital-doesnt-have-to-be-disruptive]
  • Capture opportunities created through digital technology
  • Have a strategic business mindset that includes digital opportunities
  • Make sure that the organizational structure can handle digital complexity and velocity


Scaling is Hard Erik Wilde (@dret): Using the Network Effect: API Strategy is more than Technology

(9) Transforming Non-Digital Organizations

  • Business: Perceiving and capturing digital opportunities
  • Organization: Creating and using digital building blocks
  • Technology: Providing a platform of digital building blocks

(11) Everybody Builds on/for Everybody

  • Every product uses building blocks and is a building block
  • Digital needs scale and coverage to take off
  • API-if-we-have-nothing-better-to-do hardly ever works

(16) #3: Plan for Scale & Diversity

  • Start small but do not architect yourself into a corner
  • Scale will be needed to not grind to a halt when things take off
  • Diversity is needed to allow different designs and solutions to be used
  • Decentralization is needed to give agile teams more autonomy


Simple API Amplifiers Erik Wilde (@dret): Using the Network Effect: API Strategy is more than Technology
